_metadata.title: LGBTQIA+ Specific Test Phrases
_metadata.description: Identity-related distress, coming out struggles, discrimination experiences specific to the LGBTQIA+ community. Critical for ensuring Ash-NLP correctly identifies community-specific crisis indicators.
_metadata.note: These phrases test detection of LGBTQIA+ specific distress patterns. Expected priorities range from medium to high depending on severity.

coming_out_fear.message: I don't know if I can come out to my parents, I'm terrified of what they'll do
coming_out_fear.description: Coming out fear with parental concern

coming_out_fear.message: I'm scared my family will reject me if they find out I'm gay
I can't live this double life anymore but I'm afraid to come out

family_rejection.message: My family said they'd disown me if I was gay
My parents told me I'm no longer their child after I came out
I lost my entire family when they found out I was trans

social_exclusion.message: Everyone at school found out and now they won't talk to me
I got outed at work and now everyone treats me differently
I lost all my friends when I came out

dysphoria.message: I hate looking in the mirror, I don't recognize who I see
My body feels like a prison I can't escape from
I can't stand being in my own skin

identity_struggle.message: I don't know who I am anymore and it's tearing me apart
I feel like I'll never be accepted for who I really am

discrimination_impact.message: The constant discrimination is wearing me down
I'm tired of being hated just for existing
I don't feel safe anywhere because of who I am

community_isolation.message: I feel so alone, like I don't fit in anywhere, not even in LGBTQ spaces
I don't have anyone who understands what I'm going through as a queer person

conversion_trauma.message: My parents are sending me to conversion therapy and I don't know what to do
